description.narrative: By 2020 juvenile justice-friendly procedures are in place, which contributes to Access To Justice, Justice For Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 adolescents and young people benefit from improved social policies and systems to reduce risks affecting their health and development, and are empowered for meaningful participation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020 juvenile justice-friendly procedures are in place

description.narrative: The CO actively took advantage of the developing opportunities on J4CA, advancing a high-level policy dialogue for strengthened commitment to restorative justice; initiatives of restorative social services and legislative developments; as well as uplifting strategic partnerships with the Ministry of Justice, Investigative Committee, Ministry of Interior and the Supreme Court. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2019

title.narrative: Existence of specialized justice for children systems, such as capacity building and standards-setting within criminal and civil justice systems

baseline.value: Criminal and civil procedure codes have special claused on participation, however system lacks specialised training and sustainability

target.value: 2020:Existence of intersectoral plan for implementation of Restorative justice Concept for development of legislative framework and approved by Government

actual.value: 2019:Concept on J4CA and Action Plan has been developed by the Working group which includes all key stake holders among governmental law-enforcement agencies. The Concept was presented during the International conference on restorative justice (Minsk, 23 May 2019) and got an approval of the line ministri

title.narrative: Restorative Justice service response tested in at least three centers and practice documented

actual.value: 2019:Services were developed in two centers (Leninsky district of Minsk) and Baranovichy City. The Mink city has expressed the interest to scale up this service in all its social pedagogue centers in the city.
